text: > Consider the stance of the source: » It’s important to identify the source’s point of view (bias). > Would the author have a reason to slant the information? > Omit essential facts or details? > Identifying the source is the first step towards evaluating whether the source’s bias would be a concern. > For instance, would the source be trying to convince you of an idea? Sell something? Call you to action? > Do any of those purposes call the information in . the source into question?
